oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Billy Sherrill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1981 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Billy Sherrill. The recording takes place on 11-13-81.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Billy Sherrill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two, Tape 1 of 2 - (0:20) -- Billy Sherrill discusses marriage and his personal religious beliefs. (3:57) -- Billy Sherrill discusses his variation on recording a waltz (3/4 time). (4:58) -- Billy Sherrill mentions recording with Jack Scott. (5:12) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about trends in country music songwriting. (7:04) -- Billy Sherrill mentions that he usually produces an album in three days time. (10:35) -- Billy Sherrill mentions working with David Allan Coe. (11:58) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about his professional relationship with his artists. Bob mentions that he's heard that Billy Sherrill treats his artists like family. (12:40) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about Elvis Costello. (13:23) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Elvis Costello contacting him about recording Billy's song "Too Far Gone." (15:26) -- Billy Sherrill speaks about Elvis Costello's appreciation for older country music such as George Jones and Lefty Frizzell. (16:48) -- Bob Allen and Billy Sherrill discuss Elvis Costello's stylistic differences. (18:55) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about Hank Williams' influence. (21:02) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill what he looks for in new talent. (23:21) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about whether an artist's appearance plays a role with their success. (24:20) -- Billy Sherrill suggests that an artist should reach out to a publishing company when pitching their music. (25:51) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about various musical artists and his first reaction to their names. (26:41) -- Billy Sherrill discusses his first reaction to hearing country music. (28:17) -- Billy Sherrill discusses recording a duet with Johnny Cash and Ray Charles. (30:10) -- Billy Sherrill mentions that he hates yodeling except for "Cattle Call" by Eddy Arnold. (31:12) -- Billy Sherrill shares a story about Bob Dylan. (34:03) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill if he wants to become a rock music producer. "Nope." - Billy Sherrill (35:30) -- Bob Allen asks Billy Sherrill about the future of country music.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Sherrill, Billy;
